verses.verse: Then Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Shall a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of words <S%H1697><s%> go <S%H6030><s%> unanswered, <S%H3808><s%> <S%H6030><s%> And a talkative <S%H8193><s%> man <S%H376><s%> be acquitted <S%H6663><s%>?
"Shall your boasts <S%H907><s%> silence <S%H2790><s%> men <S%H4962><s%>? And shall you scoff <S%H3932><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> rebuke <S%H3637><s%>?
"For you have said, <S%H559><s%> 'My teaching <S%H3948><s%> is pure, <S%H2134><s%> And I am <S%H1961><s%> innocent <S%H1249><s%> in your eyes. <S%H5869><s%>'
"But would <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that God <S%H433><s%> might speak, <S%H1696><s%> And open <S%H6605><s%> His lips <S%H8193><s%> against <S%H5973><s%> you,

And show <S%H5046><s%> you the secrets <S%H8587><s%> of wisdom! <S%H2451><s%> For sound <S%H8454><s%> wisdom <S%H8454><s%> has two <S%H3718><s%> sides. <S%H3718><s%> Know <S%H3045><s%> then that God <S%H433><s%> forgets <S%H5382><s%> a part of your iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>
"Can you discover <S%H4672><s%> the depths <S%H2714><s%> of God <S%H433><s%>? Can you discover <S%H4672><s%> the limits <S%H8503><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>?

"[They are] high <S%H1363><s%> as the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> can you do <S%H6466><s%>? Deeper <S%H6013><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> can you know <S%H3045><s%>?
"Its measure <S%H4055><s%> is longer <S%H752><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the earth, <S%H776><s%> And broader <S%H7342><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the sea. <S%H3220><s%>
"If <S%H518><s%> He passes <S%H2498><s%> by or shuts <S%H5462><s%> up, Or calls <S%H6950><s%> an assembly, <S%H6950><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can restrain <S%H7725><s%> Him?
"For He knows <S%H3045><s%> false <S%H7723><s%> men, <S%H4962><s%> And He sees <S%H7200><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> investigating. <S%H995><s%>

"And an idiot <S%H376><s%> <S%H5014><s%> will become <S%H3823><s%> intelligent <S%H3823><s%> When the foal <S%H5895><s%> of a wild <S%H6501><s%> donkey <S%H6501><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> a man. <S%H120><s%>
"If <S%H518><s%> you would direct <S%H3559><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> right, <S%H3559><s%> And spread <S%H6566><s%> out your hand <S%H3709><s%> to Him;

If <S%H518><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> is in your hand, <S%H3027><s%> put <S%H7368><s%> it far <S%H7368><s%> away, <S%H7368><s%> And do not let wickedness <S%H9390><s%> dwell <S%H7931><s%> in your tents. <S%H168><s%>

"Then, <S%H227><s%> indeed, <S%H3588><s%> you could lift <S%H5375><s%> up your face <S%H6440><s%> without <S%H4480><s%> [moral] defect, <S%H9249><s%> And you would be steadfast <S%H3332><s%> and not fear. <S%H3372><s%>
"For you would forget <S%H7911><s%> [your] trouble, <S%H5999><s%> As waters <S%H4325><s%> that have passed <S%H5674><s%> by, you would remember <S%H2142><s%> [it.]
"And your life <S%H2465><s%> would be brighter <S%H6965><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> noonday; <S%H6672><s%> Darkness <S%H9646><s%> would be like the morning. <S%H1242><s%>

"Then you would trust, <S%H982><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is hope; <S%H8615><s%> And you would look <S%H2658><s%> around <S%H2658><s%> and rest <S%H7901><s%> securely. <S%H983><s%>
"You would lie <S%H7257><s%> down <S%H7257><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> would disturb <S%H2729><s%> [you,] And many <S%H7227><s%> would entreat <S%H9134><s%> your favor. <S%H6440><s%>

"But the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> will fail, <S%H3615><s%> And there will be no escape <S%H6><s%> for them; And their hope <S%H4498><s%> is to breathe <S%H8615><s%> their last. <S%H4646><s%>"
